channel.title: How do i host my server 24/7
channel.description: Hey i know you can do it but i need a link please don't say "leave your laptop on" , Can't you just get a vps or a dedicated server or don't they work with runescape retros??? Any help? Thanks

item.title: How do i host my server 24/7
item.dc:creator: @Sivan Sivan
item.description:
@Sivan wrote:

[quote=“benscape, post:7, topic:256516”][quote author=PhillyClarke2 link=topic=338810.msg2628289#msg2628289 date=1231960523]
Hey i know you can do it but i need a link please don’t say “leave your laptop on” ,
Can’t you just get a vps or a dedicated server or don’t they work with runescape retros??? Any help? Thanks
[/quote]

VPS does cost money like most others have said, also there is some helpful tips on stormcutters tutorial which is stickied in the tutorial section :)[/quote]

the tut on moparscape is great you can get vps for 4.99pounds however a 128mbs speed one.
which means a bit faster than my modem about 28mbs but anyway still it makes it 24/7.

Read full topic

item.title: How do i host my server 24/7
item.dc:creator: @xxlukexx xxlukexx
item.description:
@xxlukexx wrote:

[quote=“wewtwewt3, post:2, topic:256516”]You can buy a vps which will cost you a decent few every month which I would not recommend because buying a vps for just a private server is a waste. I suggest finding someone who can host your server or if you have any extra computer lying around your house like I’ve seen many people do is to reuse them as web servers and put there private servers on there so they don’t have to bother leaving on there main computer.

Just my idea :)[/quote]

yeah, just get a vps or just leave on ur comp, thats what most people do or even get a mate to host.

Read full topic

You can buy a vps which will cost you a decent few every month which I would not recommend because buying a vps for just a private server is a waste. I suggest finding someone who can host your server or if you have any extra computer lying around your house like I’ve seen many people do is to reuse them as web servers and put there private servers on there so they don’t have to bother leaving on there main computer.

Just my idea
